text: Tall slim 200 ml bottle with (natural) cork, from Systembolaget Avenyn, Göteborg. Brännland Iscider Fatlagrad Barrique 2014 at 11.7% ABV. Sampled on June 17, 2017.Clear golden to amber color, thick very slow beautiful legs. Sweet, apple, warm, wood, alcohol scent. Sweet, apple, some raisin like, wood taste. Intense sweet apple aftertaste. Warming alcohol. Full smooth lovely mouthfeel. Some less alcohol toch in scent and it would be a full 5.0 total for me I guess. Lovely lovely stuff, if not for the price I could really see myself getting plenty more bottles of this!Rather sweet indeed though, so for the not so much sweet lovers could be too sweet perhaps?
Bottle at Craigs. Pours golden, nose is stewed apple, oak, funk, taste is juicy, tart, apple, sweet toffee.

bottle at home thanks to Nisse666 ... golden amber .. again im getting that odd mix of dry apple tanins and the ice sweetness .. dry apple peel front ... oily apple fruit nose ... big sweet apple .. juicy sweet rich apple .. little spice from the concentrated apple .. and concentrated tanins .. big sweet apples .. rich full boddied .. sweet apples

Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing! Pours clear dark golden colour. Aroma of concentrated sweet apples, strong apples, honey. Taste of intense sweet concentrated apples, sugar, honey, slighty woody, a bit boozy, really nice dessert.

Many thanks to Nisse666 for this bottle! Extreme concentrated fruity nose. The cider starts thick and rich. Lots of concentrated ripe apples, extremely concentrated, nice sourness, woody parts, spices (cinnamon, clove), great dry ripe dried apples. Long intense rich body, extremely well-balanced, not too sour, not too sweet. Great wood, rich ripe apples, fascinating stuff!
Bottle. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity spicy woody tart apple aroma. Fruity spicy woody apple flavor. Has a sweetish woody spicy tart apple finish.

Enormous thanks Viktor for the two-sip-dip bottle! Lovely viscous dark golden body. The aroma jumps around indecisively but interesting between fresh and fermented green apples, before throwing some coconut around and finally showing the boozy barrel touches, some raw alcohol, vaguely pukey touches. Its all over the place, not always pleasant, but lovely when it is. The taste is a surprise then, the chewy appley tartness kicks in and is mellowed by a background sweetness that melds seamlessly with it. Its kinda like one of those sweet chewing gums that have a sour filling that kids "tricked" other people with for the most part. And then the lovely, "noble" dryish apple taste bursts forwards. Clean, clean, clean. The alcohol is very, very hidden in the taste, showing on the tongue for a second in the finish. This is the single most tart ice cider Ive had, but its no less tasty. Woody tannins show up in the aftertaste, otherwise a quick fight to the death between the tart, dry and sweet appley notes. A fascinating beverage, unique among the ones Ive had so far.

Bottle from systembolaget, dark sticky golden, mixed of sweet red and granny Smith apples, caramel sweetness, charred wood, slight tartness of the barrels, fresh citrus, zest, sweet Apple aftertaste and a light tartness in the back. Lovely
200 mL bottle. Clear golden. Smells of apples, caramel, candy sweetness, some oak. Tastes of deep caramel and toffee. Brightens up quickly. Sharp, acidic finish. Medium heavy. Excellent.

January 13, 2017. Bottle at home. 
Clear golden with som oily legs on the glass. Aroma is fruity and slightly vinous with juicy and baked apple pulp, star fruit, apple skins, grape skins, oak, 
Taste is sweet, tart and fruity. Medium to full bodied, oily texture. Finish is tart and dry with apple and grape skins, oak notes and some fruity sweetness.
Nice one, quite tart and dry.
Bottle from SB. Golden and clear. Apples and woody tones. Fruit, acidity, sweetness and dryness. Full body with a long fruity finish.

Bottle bought through Systembolaget. Pours clear deep golden leaving some subtle legs on the glass with a swirl. Smell is fruity, woody and earthy with complex mixed apples, toffee, star fruit, dessert wine grape character, blue cheese, ash, wood, calvados alcohol and lemon zest. Taste is sweet, sour and complex fruity. Mouthfeel is round, tart, slightly oily, tiny tannic astringent, tiny boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet and heavy tart with complex apple and grape fruitiness, toffee, wood, soil and mature cheese. Incredibly complex and very delicious!

A: Deep orange/brown coloured N: Red apples, grapes, hint of oak, floral T: Sweet red apples, tart green apples, baked apples, rhubarb, floral, grapes O: Extremly well balanced sweet and tart and very nice barrels to it. NICE!

Bottle. Clear deep golden liquid. Aroma of apples, passion fruit, sweet dried fruit, raw sugar, toffee, light wood, lime peel and pineapple. Taste is medium sweet and light acidic with notes of apples, rosehip, wood and apple must. Full bodied with slick but not overly sticky mouthfeel. Wonderful, but not as complex as the 2013.
